001    package ca.hullabaloo.util.cache;
002    
003    import java.util.LinkedHashMap;
004    import java.util.Map;
005    
006    /**
007     * Least-Recently-Used cache that stores stuff in memory.
008     * 
009     * @author Darren Gilroy
010     */
011    public class LRUMemoryCache implements FixedSizeCache {
012    
013            /** The default capacity */
014            private static final int DEFAULT_CAPACITY = 16;
015    
016            /** Since this is a LinkedHashMap, it MUST be synchronized externally */
017            private final Map<Object, Entry> m_map;
018    
019            /** the capacity */
020            private final int m_capacity;
021    
022            /**
023             * Creates a new LRUMemoryCache object.
024             * 
025             * @param maxCapacity
026             */
027            public LRUMemoryCache(final int maxCapacity) {
028                    m_capacity = maxCapacity;
029                    m_map = new LinkedHashMap<Object, Entry>(m_capacity + 1, 0.75F, true) {
030                            private static final long serialVersionUID = 1L;
031    
032                            protected boolean removeEldestEntry(Map.Entry eldest) {
033                                    if (size() > m_capacity) {
034                                            return true;
035                                    } else {
036                                            return false;
037                                    }
038                            }
039                    };
040            }
041    
042            /**
043             * Creates a new LRUMemoryCache object.
044             */
045            public LRUMemoryCache() {
046                    this(DEFAULT_CAPACITY);
047            }
048    
049            /**
050             * Returns the maximum capacity of this class
051             * 
052             * @return capaciy
053             */
054            public int capacity() {
055                    return m_capacity;
056            }
057    
058            /**
059             * Clears all of the elements in the cache
060             */
061            public synchronized void clear() {
062                    m_map.clear();
063            }
064    
065            /**
066             * @see Cache#get(java.lang.Object)
067             */
068            public synchronized Entry get(Object key) {
069                    Entry entry = (Entry) m_map.get(key);
070    
071                    return entry;
072            }
073    
074            /**
075             * @see Cache#put(Cache.Entry)
076             */
077            public synchronized Entry put(Entry entry) {
078                    return (Entry) m_map.put(entry.key(), entry);
079            }
080    
081            /**
082             * @see Cache#remove(java.lang.Object)
083             */
084            public synchronized Entry remove(Object key) {
085                    return (Entry) m_map.remove(key);
086            }
087    }
